messages.title: KEVIN GOES HEAD TO HEAD WITH THE TORIES
messages.content: Cardiff West won't be won by the Lib Dems, Plaid Cymru, or the Green Party at the upcoming election, but it is possible that a Tory MP could be elected, even though the majority of voters in Cardiff West don't want that to happen. At the last General Election in 2015, Kevin Brennan won Cardiff West for Welsh Labour with 40.7% of the vote, with the Tories in a strong second place at 25.2%, and Plaid Cymru and UKIP well back on 13.9% and 11%. If you are one of the majority who doesn't want Cardiff West to be represented by a Tory MP, then it’s vital to unite and vote for Kevin as the Welsh Labour candidate on June 8th.

messages.title: Kevin Remembers Teaching in Radyr
messages.content: Kevin has fond memories of 10 years teaching at Radyr Comprehensive School. Said Kevin: 'I'm glad that we in Labour changed the catchment area to welcome children from Danescourt. It's great to meet former pupils when I'm out in the constituency. One I met recently was in charge of construction of the new BBC Wales HQ, one came to the Commons to lobby me on policy and another went on to manage one of the biggest bands in the world! I didn't dream of all this when I was helping my colleagues become the first comprehensive school in Wales. Education is the foundation of Cardiff West.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour changed the catchment area to welcome children from Danescourt. Kevin has strong experiences in education, having taught for 10 years at Radyr Comprehensive School.
